extended_metaphor.metaphor: Both Volcanic Eruptions in volcano and Repulsor Technology in Iron Man have the characteristic of Pressure Release
extended_metaphor.volcanic_eruptions: Volcanic Eruptions serve as a natural mechanism for the release of internal pressure within a magma chamber to prevent potential explosive build-up of gases and magma.
extended_metaphor.repulsor_technology: Similarly, Repulsor Technology in Iron Man functions as a built-in mechanism to release stored energy and prevent dangerous overloads, ensuring the system operates within safe parameters.

extended_metaphor.metaphor: Both Volcanic Eruptions in volcano and Repulsor Technology in Iron Man have the characteristic of Structural Design for Eruption
extended_metaphor.volcanic_eruptions: In volcanoes, the structural design allows for the directional flow of magma, gases, and ash through a vent or fissure in the crust to relieve internal pressure and facilitate eruption.
extended_metaphor.repulsor_technology: Correspondingly, Repulsor Technology in Iron Man is structured to direct and project energy outwards in a controlled manner, enabling efficient use of power and preventing internal system damage.

extended_metaphor.metaphor: Both Volcanic Eruptions in volcano and Repulsor Technology in Iron Man have the characteristic of Conduit Formation
extended_metaphor.volcanic_eruptions: Volcanic Conduit Formation uses accumulated pressure beneath the surface to create a pathway for volcanic materials to ascend and escape, mitigating internal pressure and allowing for eruption.
extended_metaphor.repulsor_technology: Likewise, Repulsor Technology harnesses stored energy to form a conduit for energy output, enabling controlled release and preventing system overload, akin to the natural conduit formation in volcanic eruptions.
